meanings.definition: To exhaust or tire out excessively.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids overtires themselves and fell asleep early.
meanings.sent2: The long hike overtires me, but I enjoy the beautiful views.
meanings.sent3: Trying to carry all the groceries in one trip overtires me every time!
meanings.sent4: The constant demands of work overtires her spirit, but she never gives up.
meanings.sent5: The marathon overtires the runners, but they feel accomplished at the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The old shoes overtires my feet, so I need new ones.
meanings.sent2: Staying up late studying overtires students before exams.
meanings.sent3: The endless loop of the same song overtires my ears.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive tasks overtires the mind, making creativity difficult.
meanings.sent5: The heavy workload overtires the employees, affecting their productivity.
